intro: Rhexia interior, commonly known as the interior rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain its seeds. Rhexia interior is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
